images.description: tiny, greyish caps in clumps on rotting stumps
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 1: Coprinellus disseminatus (Fairy bonnets) - tiny greyish caps in clumps on rotting stumps

images.description: included above, but images too indistinct to differentiate
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 2: Unidentified fungi specimen

images.description: tan, pear-shaped puffball, branched mycelial cords at base, grows on wood
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 3: Lycoperdon pyriforme (Puffball) - tan pear-shaped puffball growing on wood

images.description: hard crumbly brown to black balls on dead ash, mature black specimen
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 4: Daldinia concentrica (King Alfred's cakes) - mature black specimen on dead ash

images.description: hard crumbly brown to black balls on dead ash, young brown material
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 5: Daldinia concentrica (King Alfred's cakes) - young brown specimen on dead ash

images.description: tan, pear-shaped puffball, branched mycelial cords at base, grows on wood
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 6: Lycoperdon pyriforme (Puffball) - tan pear-shaped puffball growing on wood

images.description: grows under trees, moveable ring, flesh reddens when cut or bruised
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 7: Chlorophyllum rhacodes (Shaggy parasol) - edible mushroom growing under trees

images.description: tiny white, with very primitive, decurrent gills, on soil, damp areas near Willow and Alder
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 8: Delicatula integrella - tiny white fungi with primitive decurrent gills

images.description: very obvious yellow on scratching stem base, gills greyish-brown, carbolic smell, poisonous
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 9: Agaricus xanthodermus (Yellow staining mushroom) - poisonous species with yellow staining

images.description: included above, but images too indistinct to differentiate
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 10: Unidentified fungi specimen

images.description: pale pink-lilac crowded jelly buttons on fallen beech
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 11: Neobulgaria pura - pale pink-lilac jelly buttons on fallen beech

images.description: small yellow to orange blobs on barkless fallen timber
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 12: Dacrymyces stillatus (Jelly spot) - small yellow to orange blobs on fallen timber

images.description: soft creamy-brown 'shells' on dead wood, elastic cap skin peels off, here on fallen Beech trunk
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 13: Crepidotus mollis (Peeling Oysterling) - soft creamy-brown shells on fallen beech trunk

images.description: included above, but images too indistinct to differentiate
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 14: Unidentified fungi specimen

images.description: small tan caps, with glistening particles, in tufts on wood
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 15: Coprinellus micaceus (Glistening inkcap) - small tan caps with glistening particles

images.description: thin bracket, creamy pores, grows in tiers on dead wood, here old lacking attractive bright colour bands
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 16: Trametes versicolor (Turkey tails) - many-coloured bracket fungi on dead wood

images.description: pinky-rose-brown, 3 different gill lengths, very variable, probably this species
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 17: Laccaria laccata (Deceiver) - edible pinky-rose-brown fungi with variable appearance

images.description: small tan caps, with glistening particles, in tufts on wood
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 18: Coprinellus micaceus (Glistening inkcap) - small tan caps with glistening particles

images.description: lower surface with white pores, tubes in distinct layers
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 19: Ganoderma applanatum (Artist's fungus) - lower surface showing white pores

images.description: upper surface of old fungus, tubes in distinct layers
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 20: Ganoderma applanatum (Artist's fungus) - upper surface of old specimen

images.description: small white puffball, grows in leaf litter, small 'pearls' rub off, here some lovely fresh specimens
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 21: Lycoperdon perlatum (Puffball) - edible white puffball with small pearls, fresh specimens

images.description: Medium sized, pink to lilac cap, stem in broadleaf litter, smell of radish, poisonous
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 22: Mycena pura (Lilac mycena) - poisonous pink to lilac cap with radish smell

images.description: grows on stumps in profusion, sulphur-coloured gills darken as purplish spores mature, poisonous
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 23: Hypholoma fasciculare (Sulphur tuft) - poisonous sulphur-coloured fungi on stumps

images.description: golden-brown viscous caps, margins drying paler, grows in tufts on stumps, here in poor condition
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 24: Kuehneromyces mutabilis - golden-brown caps growing in tufts on stumps

images.description: upper surface, tubes in distinct layers
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 25: Ganoderma applanatum (Artist's fungus) - upper surface showing layered structure

images.description: pale pink-lilac crowded jelly buttons on fallen beech
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 26: Neobulgaria pura - pale pink-lilac jelly buttons on fallen beech

images.description: tiny, greyish caps in clumps on rotting stumps, close up view
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 27: Coprinellus disseminatus (Fairy bonnets) - close up of tiny greyish caps in clumps

images.description: encrusting resupinate, grows over bare soil and plant remains to form creamy patches, waxy, here in moss on decayed fallen broadleaf tree
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 28: Sebacina incrustans - waxy creamy patches in moss on decayed tree

images.description: lower surface with pores showing exit holes of gall fly larvae
images.alt_text: Fungi foray image 29: Ganoderma applanatum (Artist's fungus) - lower surface showing gall fly larvae exit holes
